text: I think that what what has happened in
the past few decades in this part of the
world it has created many reasons for
nations like the Syrian nation or the
Lebanese nation to feel threatened by
the policies of the Zionist regime and
that is a reason for governments like
the government of Syria to stand up in
face of that but well that's I think no
justification for oppressing one's own
nation I think that that that is
something that the people should decide
for policies internal policies of
nations should be determined by those
nations themselves by their people and I
think that that is one area where
unfortunately terrorist groups have
infiltrated Syria and unfortunately what
has happened now in Syria is a disaster
for the people and I hope that the
people the Syrian nation they'll be able
and this is this has been the policy of
the government to work with the Syrian
government to ensure that they have
peace and security in their country and
they can get rid of the terrorists and
they can strengthen the democratic
processes in the country I think that
that is what our government was not
working with the Syrian government then
I asked you about - the so-called
Islamic state Iran officials Iranian
officials have said that they would help
fight Isis I asked after a nuclear deal
why not before you didn't want to or you
couldn't I think that we have played our
role in working with the different
governments in the region and working
with the government of Iraq working
trying to control extremism and
radicalism I think that Iran has already
played an important role and probably
after the nuclear deal will we will play
a more stronger role in that region
foreign minister is now traveling in the
region because maintaining ties
restoring actually trusts with our
neighbors is a major issue for us we are
hope to be able to restore that trust
working with different regional states
to be able to stand firm against
extremism against terrorism against -
which is on the Islamic state the
so-called Islamic state is that one area
of possible further cooperation with the
West we have many areas of cooperation
in the past even on narcotics on
Afghanistan on Iraq we've we've worked
in many different areas I think now for
now for the time being the focus will be
on implementing new cleared settlement
the nuclear deal that's that's the most
important area where we're going to work
together but of course security issues
in the region working together to curb
extremism I think very important areas
where all nations in today's global
community they have to work together are
you going to work with Saudi Arabia a
lot of the tension in the region is
driven by the rivalry between you and
Saudi Arabia is a time for a peace
summit we have been trying to establish
a dialogue we've been working through
diplomatic channels we believe that we
need to work with countries in the
region in different areas security trade
even the environments we have important
convention the Kuwait Convention in the
Persian Gulf area and that's dealing
with the environmental challenges
various organizational
confidence-building yeah we have to work
together we're living in one region
together and if we look to the
prosperity of our nations we have to
work together we have to work to resolve
the war in Yemen which is devastating
that nation we have to work together to
resolve many of the outstanding issues
including - in the region and
I think that it's it's very necessary
that we work through diplomatic channels
to resolve this issue and particularly
the fact that some of these countries
have been trying to give an image a very
negative image about Iran and the role
of Iran in the region and the world and
to indicate that Iran has no intention
to occupy the region or to dominate over
the region but Iran doesn't intend to
work for peace and security in this
region we live in a time of
unprecedented population growth in 2015
the world has around 7.3 billion
inhabitants
